issue.title: foreach() argument must be of type array|object, string given error
Enabling the checkbox for job alerts in the backend (to allow receiving emails) breaks the alerts form in the user frontend
issue.body:
Bug:

When the checkbox for job alerts in the backend (to allow receiving emails) is activated, you get the following behaviour:

1. in job alerts on the user frontend when you enter nothing and try to save, nothing happens, especially there is no error message and the user does not know, what’s going on
2. same when you do enter alert criteria and don’t check the checkbox (in the alerts frontend form) → no error message, as otherwise usual

To Reproduce:

Switch the checkbox in the backend on/off and test the alerts frontend form. If the backend checkbox is switched off, all is fine again → 1. works as expected and the user gets an error message

Expected behavior:

Alerts frotend form has no issues depending on the checkbox-setting.

- WP 6.3.1
- Latest public release of of the WPJM package as of now
- Cariera theme latest version as of now
- PHP 8

issue.title: Enabling the checkbox for job alerts in the backend (to allow receiving emails) breaks the alerts form in the user frontend
issue.body:
Bug:

When the checkbox for job alerts in the backend (to allow receiving emails) is activated, you get the following behaviour:

1. in job alerts on the user frontend when you enter nothing and try to save, nothing happens, especially there is no error message and the user does not know, what’s going on
2. same when you do enter alert criteria and don’t check the checkbox (in the alerts frontend form) → no error message, as otherwise usual

To Reproduce:

Switch the checkbox in the backend on/off and test the alerts frontend form. If the backend checkbox is switched off, all is fine again → 1. works as expected and the user gets an error message

Expected behavior:

Alerts frotend form has no issues depending on the checkbox-setting.

- WP 6.3.1
- Latest public release of of the WPJM package as of now
- Cariera theme latest version as of now
- PHP 8

comment.body: Hello @promptpress, I have tried the steps you suggested and a popup currently exists that explains to the user to check the checkbox in order to proceed. This seems like a conflict with your theme or your local installation. If you have purchased Alerts from [our website](https://wpjobmanager.com) and you have an active license, I would suggest to request support by following the appropriate link in [our support page](https://wpjobmanager.com/support/).

issue.title: Listing renewals not compatible with Application Deadline add-on
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
As of 1.41.0, the new "Listings renewal" feature is not compatible with your [Application Deadline](https://wpjobmanager.com/document/application-deadline/) add-on. 

If a user previously selected an early closing date (via the field added by the Application Deadline add-on) for their job listing, the user isn't provided an opportunity to choose a new closing date in the "Listing renewal" submission flow, nor is the closing date extended automatically when the user renews the job listing to extend the listing's expiration date.

**Expected behavior**
The user is taken to the editing form when choosing to renew their job listing, so that they have the opportunity to see and change any closing date previously selected, just like how the submission flow works if they were relisting an expired job listing.

comment.body: Hello @Hastibe. So during renewal both the application deadline date and the normal expiry would be increased by the duration of the package that was used to renew the listing.

issue.title: applicantLocationRequirements schema now required for Remote (TELECOMMUTE) jobs

labels.name: Customer Report
labels.description: Issues or PRs that were reported via Happiness. Previously known as "Happiness Request".

issue.body:
Google just pushed an update that delists jobs when TELECOMMUTE and not including the applicantLocationRequirements schema.
Would be great if we could implement this as a field!

pull_request.title: Bump @babel/traverse from 7.21.4 to 7.23.2
pull_request.body:
Bumps [@babel/traverse](https://github.com/babel/babel/tree/HEAD/packages/babel-traverse) from 7.21.4 to 7.23.2.
Release notes

Sourced from @​babel/traverse's releases.

v7.23.2 (2023-10-11)

NOTE: This release also re-publishes @babel/core, even if it does not appear in the linked release commit.

Thanks @​jimmydief for your first PR!

:bug: Bug Fix

  • babel-traverse
    • #16033 Only evaluate own String/Number/Math methods (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
  • babel-preset-typescript
    • #16022 Rewrite .tsx extension when using rewriteImportExtensions (@​jimmydief)
  • babel-helpers
    • #16017 Fix: fallback to typeof when toString is applied to incompatible object (@​JLHwung)
  • babel-helpers, babel-plugin-transform-modules-commonjs, babel-runtime-corejs2, babel-runtime-corejs3, babel-runtime
    • #16025 Avoid override mistake in namespace imports (@​nicolo-ribaudo)

Committers: 5

  • Babel Bot (@​babel-bot)
  • Huáng Jùnliàng (@​JLHwung)
  • James Diefenderfer (@​jimmydief)
  • Nicolò Ribaudo (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
  • @​liuxingbaoyu

v7.23.1 (2023-09-25)

Re-publishing @babel/helpers due to a publishing error in 7.23.0.

v7.23.0 (2023-09-25)

Thanks @​lorenzoferre and @​RajShukla1 for your first PRs!

:rocket: New Feature

  • babel-plugin-proposal-import-wasm-source, babel-plugin-syntax-import-source, babel-plugin-transform-dynamic-import
    • #15870 Support transforming import source for wasm (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
  • babel-helper-module-transforms, babel-helpers, babel-plugin-proposal-import-defer, babel-plugin-syntax-import-defer, babel-plugin-transform-modules-commonjs, babel-runtime-corejs2, babel-runtime-corejs3, babel-runtime, babel-standalone
    • #15878 Implement import defer proposal transform support (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
  • babel-generator, babel-parser, babel-types
    • #15845 Implement import defer parsing support (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
    • #15829 Add parsing support for the "source phase imports" proposal (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
  • babel-generator, babel-helper-module-transforms, babel-parser, babel-plugin-transform-dynamic-import, babel-plugin-transform-modules-amd, babel-plugin-transform-modules-commonjs, babel-plugin-transform-modules-systemjs, babel-traverse, babel-types
    • #15682 Add createImportExpressions parser option (@​JLHwung)
  • babel-standalone
    • #15671 Pass through nonce to the transformed script element (@​JLHwung)
  • babel-helper-function-name, babel-helper-member-expression-to-functions, babel-helpers, babel-parser, babel-plugin-proposal-destructuring-private, babel-plugin-proposal-optional-chaining-assign, babel-plugin-syntax-optional-chaining-assign, babel-plugin-transform-destructuring, babel-plugin-transform-optional-chaining, babel-runtime-corejs2, babel-runtime-corejs3, babel-runtime, babel-standalone, babel-types
    • #15751 Add support for optional chain in assignments (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
  • babel-helpers, babel-plugin-proposal-decorators
    • #15895 Implement the "decorator metadata" proposal (@​nicolo-ribaudo)
  • babel-traverse, babel-types
    • #15893 Add t.buildUndefinedNode (@​liuxingbaoyu)
  • babel-preset-typescript

... (truncated)

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. issue.title: Job Tags In-Editor Upsell
issue.body:
Add a Job Tags upsell area in the Job Listings Editor

- Make sure it only loads for Job Listings
- "Get Job Tags" should take you to the Job Tags product page
- When Job Tags is active, this should disappear

Design:


![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3220162/269060416-f6278ca2-b83e-4fc6-bd84-058382589b5e.png)

issue.title: Resumes and Applications "Upsell Pages"
issue.body:
If Resumes or Applications are not installed, they will each have an upsell item in the main WPJM menu and each of those will have a page where you can see more information about them.

- Add pages for both Resumes and Applications
- Those pages will have a small blurb about the add-ons and a CTA to go to the Add-on page on wpjobmanager.com
- We should track how often these are clicked, maybe using `bump_stats`?

Figma: 37L7Kp5nnrxhh5uXjGZorw-fi-20019540_8941

Design:
![Image](https://github.com/Automattic/WP-Job-Manager/assets/3220162/6c3c084f-ac79-4387-bbaa-30e22a2bd244)
![Image](https://github.com/Automattic/WP-Job-Manager/assets/3220162/85b13133-f73c-4efc-a1e3-f7c5b0873990)

issue.title: Redesign Extensions Page
issue.body:
- Updated Filters *Default to ALL*
- New design for Add-on cards
- New Search bar at top
- New top tab design

Design:
![Image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3220162/269058862-746c3eee-5338-4dc2-a5dd-653a330b9d87.png)

review.body:
Looking great, Peter!

One thing I noticed is that when I dismiss the "Did you know?" Notice, it also dismisses the "Improve your experience" notice.  It's happening because of this hook tha twas added:

```
add_action( 'wp_job_manager_notice_dismissed', [ $this, 'handle_tracking_opt_out' ] );
```
Is that the intended result?  I would think that dismissing one notice should only dismiss that notice itself and not the other ones.

pull_request.title: Update notices
pull_request.body: Fixes #2581 Based on #2614 for shared styles ### Changes Proposed in this Pull Request * Update notice styles * Bring all notices to use the new notice system * Use a single 'license required' notice for all add-on license issues * Limit showing most of the add-ons to main job listing page and settings * Various copy & action improvements * Add a few helper methods to get the product icon for an add-on, and a few fixes to the license keys page ### Testing Instructions * Playground: [Existing site](https://wpjobmanager.com/playground/?core=2023/10/2620-7e20a6fb&url=/wp-admin) | [Fresh site](https://wpjobmanager.com/playground/?core=2023/10/2620-7e20a6fb&site=empty&url=/wp-admin) * Reset dismissed notices: `wp option delete wp_job_manager_dismissed_notices` * Reset usage tracking notice: * Turn off usage tracking * `wp option delete job_manager_usage_tracking_opt_in_hide` * `wp option delete job_manager_display_usage_tracking_once` * Updates, licenses: * Add older versions of a few add-ons from https://github.com/Automattic/wpjm-addons/releases * In `wp shell`: * `include_once JOB_MANAGER_PLUGIN_DIR . '/includes/helper/class-wp-job-manager-helper.php'; WP_Job_Manager_Helper::instance()->check_for_updates([]);` ### Release Notes * Clean up, update and style admin notices ### New or Updated Hooks and Templates * ### Deprecated Code * ### Screenshot / Video ---- | Plugin build for 7e20a6fb | | ------------------------------------------------------------ | | 📦 [Download plugin zip](https://wpjobmanager.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/wp-job-manager-zip-2620-7e20a6fb.zip) | | ▶️ [Open in playground](https://wpjobmanager.com/playground/?core=2023/10/2620-7e20a6fb) |

pull_request.title: Add Applications and Resumes upsell pages
pull_request.body: Fixes: https://github.com/Automattic/WP-Job-Manager/pull/2614 ### Changes Proposed in this Pull Request * Add a new class registering and rendering the new pages * Add menu items to the Job Manager menu * Add filter and option to hide the pages (ie when their plugins are installed) * Add a **job_manager_brand** style that contains some common CSS for the branded parts we are adding, like buttons and colors * Some tweaks compared to the design: * Removed the 'Add New' button as adding applications/resumes on the backend is not really a thing * Added dismiss option * Simpler copy for the secondary button * Resumes → Resume Manager as that's the official name * Both buttons link to the product page for now ### Testing Instructions * Checkout branch, build CSS with npm run start | [Open in playground](https://wpjobmanager.com/playground/?core=2023/10/2614-52e83bdf&url=/wp-admin/edit.php?post_type=job_listing) * Check that menu items are added * Check their content looks right and all links work * Check the pages can be dismissed ### Release Notes * Add new info pages for the Applications and Resume Manager extensions. ### New or Updated Hooks and Templates * *job_manager_addon_upsell_applications* - set to false to hide Applications info page * *job_manager_addon_upsell_resumes* - set to false to hide Resumes info page ### Screenshot / Video ![image](https://github.com/Automattic/WP-Job-Manager/assets/176949/4a00fcdd-2d28-4e36-87ca-7717db566c6e) ![image](https://github.com/Automattic/WP-Job-Manager/assets/176949/886c0727-4db4-42dd-b290-437c3ec48977) ---- | Plugin build for 29b83855d5f78bc2b2aa333e88e65ae1972003cd | | ------------------------------------------------------------ | | 📦 [Download plugin zip](https://wpjobmanager.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/wp-job-manager-zip-2614-29b83855.zip) | | ▶️ [Open in playground](https://wpjobmanager.com/playground/?core=2023/10/2614-29b83855) |
